timeline.message:
fix(e2e): Fix query e2e tests not accounting for propagation delays

Now every query test will re-run the query until the expected conditions are met or a timeout occurs

timeline.bodyText: The emulator tasks have hit this 10 minute mark and failed even though the emulator is ready to use in the next step, so I've bumped up the timeout to allow for slower emulator start up times
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -241,7 +243,7 @@ jobs:
       - task: Bash@3
         condition: eq(variables['task.android.needToRunTestGroup'], 'yes')
         displayName: 'Start Android Emulator'
-        timeoutInMinutes: 10

timeline.message:
refactor(e2e): Simplify parameterization of query tests

By inheriting from DeviceTwinCommon, each query test was run for every device side protocol and for every device side authentication. These query tests are entirely service client tests, though. It doesn't make sense to parameterize them on device client settings
fix(e2e): Fix query e2e tests not accounting for propagation delays
fix(e2e): Fix query e2e tests not accounting for propagation delays
